channel.title: Pantrynomic Analysis on Superphysics: A New Science
channel.description: Recent content in Pantrynomic Analysis on Superphysics: A New Science

item.title: An Agricultural America
item.description: In Book 3 of the Wealth of Nations, Adam Smith advocated that agricultural countries should max out their capital on agriculture first before investing it on industry, specifically to build ships and logistics technology. He gives example of Egypt, India, and China which were technologically backward relative to Rome and Europe. This implies that Smith preferred the American colonies to stay backward in the short term and source its technology from Britain.

item.title: China, Vietnam, and Adam Smith
item.description: During the cold war, two flavors of Communism arose: The Soviet Stalin flavor The Chinese Mao flavor Outside of the Soviet Union, the Stalin flavor was implemented in: Cuba Vietnam Outside of China, the Mao flavor was implemented in: North Korea Cambodia The Mao flavor was totally replaced in 1980 with the Deng flavor. The Stalin flavor died in 1991, to be replaced with the Putin flavor in Russia.

item.title: Kishida: New Capitalism
item.description: Growth strategy Promotion of science and technology nation Strengthening investment in science and technology / innovation to promote a nation of science and technology 10 trillion yen university fund / university reform To form the world’s highest level research university, a university fund of 10 trillion yen will be set up within this year. In addition, governance is required of research universities that are comparable to the rest of the world.
